About.paragraph: The SJCET Startup Bootcamp- IEDC (Innovation and Entrepreneurship Development Centre) was set up on 9th March 2015 as a part of the Kerala Startup Mission (KSUM) initiative to develop a startup culture amongst students. The IEDCs are platforms set up in Engineering, Management, Arts & Science Colleges and Polytechnics with an aim to provide students an opportunity to experiment and innovate. KSUM has set up IEDCs in 226 institutions across the State which provide avenues for creative students to learn, collaborate and transform their innovative ideas into prototypes of viable products and services. IEDCs works as the first launch pad for a studentâ€™s entrepreneurial journey and provide them with access to cutting edge technology, world class infrastructure, high quality mentorship, early risk capital and global exposure.
Why: To create an innovation culture among Innovators
To create a platform for students to experiment and innovate
Positioning the Institution as a Learning and Innovation Platform by delivering technically competent and skilled Entrepreneurs
Why2: To create IEDC as an Innovation Platform and to create future founders by promoting Innovation, Technology and Business Learning among student community

Whyiedc.title: MENTORING
Whyiedc.text: Startup bootcamp provides mentoring support to help the students in developing innovative ideas, setting goals and exploring careers which is best suited.

Whyiedc.title: INNOVATION
Whyiedc.text: Startup bootcamp provides students with assistance in projects through innovative ideas which can be utilised for future endeavours

Whyiedc.title: NETWORKING
Whyiedc.text: Startup bootcamp helps students in connecting them with other personalities to identify their potential and increase their opportunities

Whyiedc.title: INCUBATION
Whyiedc.text: Startup bootcamp provides incubation support to students by giving opportunity to express their innovative ideas and make it work
